intro: Larephes parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered larephes, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer months, making it a sought-after species for botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native range.
